page.title: 01Leverton,General review
page.content: Our area is in South Lincolnshire bordering on the{Wash}in the part which was formerly called Holland.The land is flat and fertile and is mainly used for{agriculture.}People have lived in this part of the country since at least Roman times.The population is small and scattered over the whole area.The land is criss-crossed by single track roads and drainage dykes which eventually drain into the sea through two pumping stations .The dykes are important because most of the land is at or below sea level.We are protected from the sea by banks of earth which were made as land has been reclaimed from the sea.The{outmarsh}is used as a recreation area,a bombing range , wildfowling and pasture for sheep and cattle for local farmers,a custom which goes back many years.
